trans-unit.source: SharePoint Server 2013 farm Phase 1 | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: SharePoint Server 2013 farm Phase 1 | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Create the virtual network and other Azure infrastructure elements in Phase 1 of the SharePoint Server 2013 farm in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Create the virtual network and other Azure infrastructure elements in Phase 1 of the SharePoint Server 2013 farm in Azure.

trans-unit.source: In this phase of deploying an intranet-only SharePoint 2013 farm with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure infrastructure services, you build out the Azure networking and storage infrastructure in Azure Service Management.
trans-unit.target: In this phase of deploying an intranet-only SharePoint 2013 farm with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure infrastructure services, you build out the Azure networking and storage infrastructure in Azure Service Management.

trans-unit.source: You must complete this phase before moving on to <linkText>Phase 2</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You must complete this phase before moving on to <linkText>Phase 2</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Deploying SharePoint with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure</linkText><title></title> for all of the phases.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Deploying SharePoint with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure</linkText><title></title> for all of the phases.

trans-unit.source: Azure must be provisioned with these basic network components:
trans-unit.target: Azure must be provisioned with these basic network components:

trans-unit.source: A cross-premises virtual network with one subnet.
trans-unit.target: A cross-premises virtual network with one subnet.

trans-unit.source: Three Azure cloud services.
trans-unit.target: Three Azure cloud services.

trans-unit.source: One Azure storage account to store VHD disk images and extra data disks.
trans-unit.target: One Azure storage account to store VHD disk images and extra data disks.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin configuring Azure components, fill in the following tables.
trans-unit.target: Before you begin configuring Azure components, fill in the following tables.

trans-unit.source: To assist you in the procedures for configuring Azure, print this section and write down the needed information or copy this section to a document and fill it in.
trans-unit.target: To assist you in the procedures for configuring Azure, print this section and write down the needed information or copy this section to a document and fill it in.

trans-unit.source: For the settings of the virtual network (VNet), fill in Table V.
trans-unit.target: For the settings of the virtual network (VNet), fill in Table V.

trans-unit.source: Item
trans-unit.target: Item

trans-unit.source: Configuration element
trans-unit.target: Configuration element

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: | VNet name | A name to assign to the Azure Virtual Network (example SPFarmNet).
trans-unit.target: | VNet name | A name to assign to the Azure Virtual Network (example SPFarmNet).

trans-unit.source: | VNet location | The Azure datacenter that will contain the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: | VNet location | The Azure datacenter that will contain the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: | Local network name | A name to assign to your organization network.
trans-unit.target: | Local network name | A name to assign to your organization network.

trans-unit.source: | VPN device IP address | The public IPv4 address of your VPN device's interface on the Internet.
trans-unit.target: | VPN device IP address | The public IPv4 address of your VPN device's interface on the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Work with your IT department to determine this address.
trans-unit.target: Work with your IT department to determine this address.

trans-unit.source: | VNet address space | The address space (defined in a single private address prefix) for the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: | VNet address space | The address space (defined in a single private address prefix) for the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Work with your IT department to determine this address space.
trans-unit.target: Work with your IT department to determine this address space.

trans-unit.source: | First final DNS server | The fourth possible IP address for the address space of the subnet of the virtual network (see Table S).
trans-unit.target: | First final DNS server | The fourth possible IP address for the address space of the subnet of the virtual network (see Table S).

trans-unit.source: Work with your IT department to determine these addresses.
trans-unit.target: Work with your IT department to determine these addresses.

trans-unit.source: | Second final DNS server | The fifth possible IP address for the address space of the subnet of the virtual network (see Table S).
trans-unit.target: | Second final DNS server | The fifth possible IP address for the address space of the subnet of the virtual network (see Table S).

trans-unit.source: Work with your IT department to determine these addresses.
trans-unit.target: Work with your IT department to determine these addresses.

trans-unit.source: Table V: Cross-premises virtual network configuration
trans-unit.target: Table V: Cross-premises virtual network configuration

trans-unit.source: Fill in Table S for the subnet of this solution.
trans-unit.target: Fill in Table S for the subnet of this solution.

trans-unit.source: Give the subnet a friendly name, a single IP address space based on the Virtual Network address space, and a descriptive purpose.
trans-unit.target: Give the subnet a friendly name, a single IP address space based on the Virtual Network address space, and a descriptive purpose.

trans-unit.source: The address space should be in Classless Interdomain Routing (CIDR) format, also known as network prefix format.
trans-unit.target: The address space should be in Classless Interdomain Routing (CIDR) format, also known as network prefix format.

trans-unit.source: An example is 10.24.64.0/20.
trans-unit.target: An example is 10.24.64.0/20.

trans-unit.source: Work with your IT department to determine this address space from the virtual network address space.
trans-unit.target: Work with your IT department to determine this address space from the virtual network address space.

trans-unit.source: Item
trans-unit.target: Item

trans-unit.source: Subnet name
trans-unit.target: Subnet name

trans-unit.source: Subnet address space
trans-unit.target: Subnet address space

trans-unit.source: Purpose
trans-unit.target: Purpose

trans-unit.source: Table S: Subnets in the virtual network
trans-unit.target: Table S: Subnets in the virtual network

trans-unit.source: This pre-defined architecture uses a single subnet for simplicity.
trans-unit.target: This pre-defined architecture uses a single subnet for simplicity.

trans-unit.source: If you want to overlay a set of traffic filters to emulate subnet isolation, you can use Azure <linkText>Network Security Groups</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you want to overlay a set of traffic filters to emulate subnet isolation, you can use Azure <linkText>Network Security Groups</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For the two on-premises DNS servers that you want to use when initially setting up the domain controllers in your virtual network, fill in Table D. Give each DNS server a friendly name and a single IP address.
trans-unit.target: For the two on-premises DNS servers that you want to use when initially setting up the domain controllers in your virtual network, fill in Table D. Give each DNS server a friendly name and a single IP address.

trans-unit.source: This friendly name does not need to match the host name or computer name of the DNS server.
trans-unit.target: This friendly name does not need to match the host name or computer name of the DNS server.

trans-unit.source: Note that two blank entries are listed, but you can add more.
trans-unit.target: Note that two blank entries are listed, but you can add more.

trans-unit.source: Work with your IT department to determine this list.
trans-unit.target: Work with your IT department to determine this list.

trans-unit.source: Item
trans-unit.target: Item

trans-unit.source: DNS server friendly name
trans-unit.target: DNS server friendly name

trans-unit.source: DNS server IP address
trans-unit.target: DNS server IP address

trans-unit.source: Table D: On-premises DNS servers
trans-unit.target: Table D: On-premises DNS servers

trans-unit.source: To route packets from the cross-premises network to your organization network across the site-to-site VPN connection, you must configure the virtual network with a local network that contains a list of the address spaces (in CIDR notation) for all of the reachable locations on your organization's on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: To route packets from the cross-premises network to your organization network across the site-to-site VPN connection, you must configure the virtual network with a local network that contains a list of the address spaces (in CIDR notation) for all of the reachable locations on your organization's on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: The list of address spaces that define your local network must not include or overlap with the address space used for other virtual networks or other local networks.
trans-unit.target: The list of address spaces that define your local network must not include or overlap with the address space used for other virtual networks or other local networks.

trans-unit.source: In other words, the address spaces for configured virtual networks and local networks must be unique.
trans-unit.target: In other words, the address spaces for configured virtual networks and local networks must be unique.

trans-unit.source: For the set of local network address spaces, fill in Table L. Note that three blank entries are listed but you will typically need more.
trans-unit.target: For the set of local network address spaces, fill in Table L. Note that three blank entries are listed but you will typically need more.

trans-unit.source: Work with your IT department to determine this list of address spaces.
trans-unit.target: Work with your IT department to determine this list of address spaces.

trans-unit.source: Item
trans-unit.target: Item

trans-unit.source: Local network address space
trans-unit.target: Local network address space

trans-unit.source: Table L: Address prefixes for the local network
trans-unit.target: Table L: Address prefixes for the local network

trans-unit.source: To create the virtual network with the settings from Tables V, S, D, and L, use the instructions in <linkText>Create a Cross-Premises Virtual Network Using Configuration Tables</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To create the virtual network with the settings from Tables V, S, D, and L, use the instructions in <linkText>Create a Cross-Premises Virtual Network Using Configuration Tables</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This procedure steps you through creating a virtual network that uses a site-to-site VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: This procedure steps you through creating a virtual network that uses a site-to-site VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: For information about using ExpressRoute for your site-to-site connection, see <linkText>ExpressRoute Technical Overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about using ExpressRoute for your site-to-site connection, see <linkText>ExpressRoute Technical Overview</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After creating the Azure virtual network, the Azure Management Portal will determine the following:
trans-unit.target: After creating the Azure virtual network, the Azure Management Portal will determine the following:

trans-unit.source: The public IPv4 address of the Azure VPN gateway for your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: The public IPv4 address of the Azure VPN gateway for your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: The Internet Protocol security (IPsec) pre-shared key for the site-to-site VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: The Internet Protocol security (IPsec) pre-shared key for the site-to-site VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: To see these in the Azure Management Portal after you create the virtual network, click Networks, click the name of the virtual network, and then click the Dashboard menu option.
trans-unit.target: To see these in the Azure Management Portal after you create the virtual network, click Networks, click the name of the virtual network, and then click the Dashboard menu option.

trans-unit.source: Next, you’ll configure the virtual network gateway to create a secure site-to-site VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: Next, you’ll configure the virtual network gateway to create a secure site-to-site VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Configure the Virtual Network Gateway in the Management Portal</linkText><title></title> for the instructions.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Configure the Virtual Network Gateway in the Management Portal</linkText><title></title> for the instructions.

trans-unit.source: Next, create the site-to-site VPN connection between the new virtual network and an on-premises VPN device.
trans-unit.target: Next, create the site-to-site VPN connection between the new virtual network and an on-premises VPN device.

trans-unit.source: For the details, see <linkText>Configure a Virtual Network Gateway in the Management Portal</linkText><title></title> for the instructions.
trans-unit.target: For the details, see <linkText>Configure a Virtual Network Gateway in the Management Portal</linkText><title></title> for the instructions.

trans-unit.source: Next, ensure that the address space of the virtual network is reachable from your on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: Next, ensure that the address space of the virtual network is reachable from your on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: This is usually done by adding a route corresponding to the virtual network address space to your VPN device and then advertising that route to the rest of the routing infrastructure of your organization network.
trans-unit.target: This is usually done by adding a route corresponding to the virtual network address space to your VPN device and then advertising that route to the rest of the routing infrastructure of your organization network.

trans-unit.source: Work with your IT department to determine how to do this.
trans-unit.target: Work with your IT department to determine how to do this.

trans-unit.source: Next, use the instructions in <linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title> to install Azure PowerShell on your local computer.
trans-unit.target: Next, use the instructions in <linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title> to install Azure PowerShell on your local computer.

trans-unit.source: Open an Azure PowerShell command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Open an Azure PowerShell command prompt.

trans-unit.source: First, select the correct Azure subscription with these commands. Replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters, with the correct names.
trans-unit.target: First, select the correct Azure subscription with these commands. Replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters, with the correct names.

trans-unit.source: You can get the subscription name from the SubscriptionName property of the output of the Get-AzureSubscription command.
trans-unit.target: You can get the subscription name from the SubscriptionName property of the output of the Get-AzureSubscription command.

trans-unit.source: Next, create the three cloud services needed for this SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: Next, create the three cloud services needed for this SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: Fill out Table C.
trans-unit.target: Fill out Table C.

trans-unit.source: Item
trans-unit.target: Item

trans-unit.source: Purpose
trans-unit.target: Purpose

trans-unit.source: Cloud service name
trans-unit.target: Cloud service name

trans-unit.source: | Domain controllers | _______________________
trans-unit.target: | Domain controllers | _______________________

trans-unit.source: | SQL servers | _______________________
trans-unit.target: | SQL servers | _______________________

trans-unit.source: | SharePoint servers | _______________________
trans-unit.target: | SharePoint servers | _______________________

trans-unit.source: Table C: Cloud service names
trans-unit.target: Table C: Cloud service names

trans-unit.source: You must pick a unique name for each cloud service.
trans-unit.target: You must pick a unique name for each cloud service.

trans-unit.source: *The cloud service name can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.
trans-unit.target: *The cloud service name can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.

trans-unit.source: The first and last character in the field must be a letter or number.*
trans-unit.target: The first and last character in the field must be a letter or number.*

trans-unit.source: For example, you could name the first cloud service DCs-UniqueSequence, in which UniqueSequence is an abbreviation of your organization.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could name the first cloud service DCs-UniqueSequence, in which UniqueSequence is an abbreviation of your organization.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your organization is named Tailspin Toys, you could name the cloud service DCs-Tailspin.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your organization is named Tailspin Toys, you could name the cloud service DCs-Tailspin.

trans-unit.source: You can test for the uniqueness of the name with the following Azure PowerShell command on your local computer.
trans-unit.target: You can test for the uniqueness of the name with the following Azure PowerShell command on your local computer.

trans-unit.source: If this command returns "False", your proposed name is unique.
trans-unit.target: If this command returns "False", your proposed name is unique.

trans-unit.source: Then, create the cloud service with the following.
trans-unit.target: Then, create the cloud service with the following.

trans-unit.source: Record the actual name of each newly-created cloud service in Table C.
trans-unit.target: Record the actual name of each newly-created cloud service in Table C.

trans-unit.source: Next, create a storage account for the SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: Next, create a storage account for the SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: You must pick a unique name that contains only lowercase letters and numbers. You can test for the uniqueness of the storage account name with the following Azure PowerShell command.
trans-unit.target: You must pick a unique name that contains only lowercase letters and numbers. You can test for the uniqueness of the storage account name with the following Azure PowerShell command.

trans-unit.source: If this command returns "False", your proposed name is unique.
trans-unit.target: If this command returns "False", your proposed name is unique.

trans-unit.source: Then, create the storage account and set the subscription to use it with these commands.
trans-unit.target: Then, create the storage account and set the subscription to use it with these commands.

trans-unit.source: Next, define the names of four availability sets.
trans-unit.target: Next, define the names of four availability sets.

trans-unit.source: Fill out Table A.
trans-unit.target: Fill out Table A.

trans-unit.source: Item
trans-unit.target: Item

trans-unit.source: Purpose
trans-unit.target: Purpose

trans-unit.source: Availability set name
trans-unit.target: Availability set name

trans-unit.source: | Domain controllers | _______________________
trans-unit.target: | Domain controllers | _______________________

trans-unit.source: | SQL servers | _______________________
trans-unit.target: | SQL servers | _______________________

trans-unit.source: | SharePoint application servers | _______________________
trans-unit.target: | SharePoint application servers | _______________________

trans-unit.source: | SharePoint front-end web servers | _______________________
trans-unit.target: | SharePoint front-end web servers | _______________________

trans-unit.source: Table A: Availability set names
trans-unit.target: Table A: Availability set names

trans-unit.source: You will need these names when you create the virtual machines in phases 2, 3, and 4.
trans-unit.target: You will need these names when you create the virtual machines in phases 2, 3, and 4.

trans-unit.source: This is the configuration resulting from the successful completion of this phase.
trans-unit.target: This is the configuration resulting from the successful completion of this phase.

trans-unit.source: To continue with the configuration of this workload, go to <linkText>Phase 2: Configure Domain Controllers</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To continue with the configuration of this workload, go to <linkText>Phase 2: Configure Domain Controllers</linkText><title></title>.
